text: Antony Hewish (11 May 1924 - 13 September 2021) was a British radio astronomer. He won the Nobel Prize for Physics in 1974 (together with fellow radio-astronomer Martin Ryle) for his role in the discovery of pulsars. He was also awarded the Eddington Medal of the Royal Astronomical Society in 1969. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1993. Hewish died on 13 September 2021, aged 97. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2021 deaths Category:English astronomers Category:English physicists Category:Academics of the University of Cambridge Category:Members of Academia Europaea Category:People from Cornwall
title: Antony Hewish
